Constructors

SwimRandomData(float, float, Vector3, float, float, bool)

Contains data pertaining to creating the SwimRandom CreatureAction.

public SwimRandomData(float evaluatePriority, float swimVelocity, Vector3 swimRadius, float swimInterval = 5, float swimForward = 0.5, bool onSphere = false)

Parameters

evaluatePriority float

The priority for this CreatureAction, expected to be in the range [0, 1].

swimVelocity float

Swim speed for this action (m/s). Typically 2-3 m/s for small fish, 4-8 m/s for medium fish and sharks, and 15-20 m/s for aggressive leviathans.

swimRadius Vector3

The distance this creature can wander in any direction every time the action is played. X and Z values should always be identical and are usually 10 - 30 meters. Typically the vertical (Y) range is only 20% - 25% of the horizontal range.

swimInterval float

The time in seconds between each change in direction. Typically 5 seconds, but more sporadic creatures may have values as low as 2 seconds.

swimForward float

The higher this value, the more this creature tends to continue swimming in the same direction. Default value is 0.5f. Typically higher (1.0f-1.2f) for larger creatures.

onSphere bool

In the vanilla game this value is typically set to 'true' for leviathans. If enabled, the creature will always swim towards a point at the maximum distance allowed by swimRadius. Otherwise, the distance will be random.
